remarks: Any infinite ordinal ` B ` is equinumerous to a power of ` _om ` .  (We are being careful here to show explicit bijections rather than simple equinumerosity because we want a uniform construction for ~ cnfcom3c .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2015.)  (Revised by AV, 4-Jul-2019.)
statement:
cnfcom.s $e |- S = dom ( _om CNF A ) $.
cnfcom.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. On ) $.
cnfcom.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. ( _om ^o A ) ) $.
cnfcom.f $e |- F = ( `' ( _om CNF A ) ` B ) $.
cnfcom.g $e |- G = OrdIso ( _E , ( F supp (/) ) ) $.
cnfcom.h $e |- H = seqom ( ( k e. _V , z e. _V |-> ( M +o z ) ) , (/) ) $.
cnfcom.t $e |- T = seqom ( ( k e. _V , f e. _V |-> K ) , (/) ) $.
cnfcom.m $e |- M = ( ( _om ^o ( G ` k ) ) .o ( F ` ( G ` k ) ) ) $.
cnfcom.k $e |- K = ( ( x e. M |-> ( dom f +o x ) ) u. `' ( x e. dom f |-> ( M +o x ) ) ) $.
cnfcom.w $e |- W = ( G ` U. dom G ) $.
cnfcom3.1 $e |- ( ph -> _om C_ B ) $.
cnfcom.x $e |- X = ( u e. ( F ` W ) , v e. ( _om ^o W ) |-> ( ( ( F ` W ) .o v ) +o u ) ) $.
cnfcom.y $e |- Y = ( u e. ( F ` W ) , v e. ( _om ^o W ) |-> ( ( ( _om ^o W ) .o u ) +o v ) ) $.
cnfcom.n $e |- N = ( ( X o. `' Y ) o. ( T ` dom G ) ) $.
cnfcom3 $p |- ( ph -> N : B -1-1-onto-> ( _om ^o W ) ) $.
$d A k x z $.
$d F f k u v x z $.
$d G f k u v x z $.
$d H f u v x $.
$d K u v $.
$d M x $.
$d S k z $.
$d T u v z $.
$d W u v x $.
$d k ph u v x z $.
